deal.features:
- Hot water bath for your aching feet? Check
- Rollers to give those doggies a good massage? Check
- Aromatherapy? Check
- Is it Mac compatible: No, we wouldn't recommend putting Mac products in these, no matter how sore they look
deal.title: Sharper Image SpaHaven Massaging Foot Bath
deal.specifications:
Specs 
====
Product: Sharper Image SpaHaven Massaging Foot Bath
Model: 10147430068, 10144950008
Condition: New
- Combines heat, bubbles, and massaging rollers to sooth tired and achy feet
- Built-in free spinning rollers relieve stress and refreshes arches, heels, and balls of the feet
- LCD display shows you the exact temperature for a perfect soak
- Removable pumice stone smooths calluses
- Digital temperature control heats up to 108°F
- 5 preset water temperature settings
- Insulated tub walls maintain temperature better
- Add your favorite essential oils for an invigorating spa experience
- 2-in-1 tray and lid stores tools and keeps out dust and debris
- Quick-drain spout to easily pour out water
- [Product Video](https://youtu.be/m6H8o95ToPs)
- [Additional Product Video](https://youtu.be/4V1cTrDdG1A)

| | | |
| ------: | :------: | :------ |
| Maximum Foot Size: | | *Fits up to men's size 13 feet* |
| Maximum Temperature: | | *108° F* |
| Number of Water Temperature Settings: | | *5* |
| Draining Method: | | *Quick-Drain Spout* |
| Display Type: | | *LCD* |
| Dimensions: | | *16.9" L x 14.4" W x 8.3" H* |
| Weight: | | *9.09 lbs* |

What's Included?
====
- 1x Sharper Image Heated Massaging Foot Bath with LCD Display
- 1x 2-in-1 Lid and Tray
- 1x Pumice Stone

Price Comparison 
====
[$99.99 at Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/SHARPER-Spahaven-Insulated-Rejuvinate-Aromatherapy/dp/B09FQF5QXQ/?tag=meh0ec-20)

story.title: Treat Your Feet
story.body:
Maybe you work a job where you're on your feet all day. Or, maybe you have some ailment, and a real-deal medical professional has told you that you should probably invest in something to soothe your aching arches and the like. Or maybe you're training for a marathon.

If any of these things are true, then you should buy this thing. Obviously.

On the other hand: maybe it's not a marathon you're training for, but rather you're doing the couch to 5k program. Or hell, maybe you're just trying to get more steps in. Or maybe you're not even doing that! Maybe you spend much of your day trapped behind a desk and much of your night on the couch, moving from professionally sedentary to casually sedentary day after day.

Still, you should buy this thing. Obviously. 

Why? Because who friggin' cares? That's why.

Sure, maybe if this thing was $400, you'd want to do some real thinking about whether or not this is something you truly need. You'd want to consider how often you'd use it, how much satisfaction you'd get out of it, and where, if anywhere, that money could be put to better use. 

But we're selling this thing about ten times less than that. 

That means, you can easily justify this purchase, whether your feet could use a warm water bath with massaging rollers and aromatherapy because you're so incredibly active or because you'd simply enjoy giving your feet a warm water bath with massaging rollers and aromatherapy.

And by the way, if you're like, *Even about $40 is too much to spend on something just to feel a little luxurious,* that's fair. But remember: We're barely past the mid-point of December. The winter is young and you've been buoyed by the joy and frantic energy of the holidays. It will only get worse from here. 

So buy one now, and then thank us for the comfort come the gray days of January and February.
